availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Gallahue (Franklin County, Kentucky, prison guard. )

body.p: Franklin County, Kentucky, farm laborer and prison guard. Kentucky native. Son of Charles Gallahue and Mary Gallahue. Attended school in Franklin County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farm laborer in Franklin County in 1860. Household owned one enslaved person in Franklin County in 1860. Prison guard at the Kentucky State Penitentiary in Frankfort in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 1, p. 16B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 1, p. 218.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 1, p. 485B.
"James Gallahue (1836-1893)," Find A Grave, Memorial 110783275, accessed March 2, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/110783275.
